snippet: The State Senate agreed to Gov. Rick Snyder’s call for spending millions in state money to spare the pensions of Detroit retirees from deeper cuts, a proposal approved last month by the House.
abstract: Michigan Senate agrees to Gov Rick Snyder’s call for spending millions in state funds to spare the pensions of Detroit retirees from deeper cuts and to avoid the sale of artworks from the city’s museum, part of a larger bargain aimed at bringing a swift close to the nation’s largest municipal bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: The State Senate agreed to Gov. Rick Snyder’s call for spending millions in state money to spare the pensions of Detroit retirees from deeper cuts, a proposal approved last month by the House.

headline.main: Michigan Senate Passes Plan to Ease Detroit Pension Cuts
headline.print_headline: State Senate Passes Plan to Ease Cuts Detroit Faces
